Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Chicken AvBD7 (AvBD-7, avian beta defensin 7; OLD Gallinacin-5, Gal 5, Gal-5, Gal5; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; birds, animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: intestinal epithelium and granulocytes, bone marrow,Gallus gallus

Literature Information.Literature: Peptide renamed based on the recommendation by Lynn DJ et al (2007) Immul Lett 110: 86-89. The sequence is now verified by experiments (see the ref). AvBD7 is active against Gram-positive bacteria (B. Subtilis, B. cereus, S. aureus, S. haemolyticus, S. saprophyticus, L. monocytogenes) and Gram-negative bacteria (E. coli, P. aeruginosa, S. Enteritidis ATCC 13076, S. Enteritidis LA5, E. cloacae, K. pneumoniae) with a MIC in the range of 0.110-0.33 uM. Updated 4/2019
Literature Information.Author: Derache C, Labas V, Aucagne V, Meudal H, Landon C, Delmas AF, Magallon T, Lalmanach AC.2009
Literature Information.Title: Primary structure and antibacterial activity of chicken bone marrow-derived beta-defensins
